intro: Hibbertia hendersonii, commonly known as the Henderson's hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, often hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Hibbertia hendersonii thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native region. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for cultivation in gardens with well-drained soil.
